    • roundRobin

      private static int roundRobin​(int K)
      The roundRobin function selects the next server number using round-robin scheduling policy
      Parameters:
      K - The total number of servers available
      Returns:
      The selected server number

    • customSP_bad

      private static int customSP_bad​(Server[] servers)
      This custom scheduling policy selects the server with the shortest queue length or the first available Server if no Jobs are currently being executed
      Parameters:
      servers - An array of Server objects, each of them with his currently executing Job (if there is one), and his FIFO queue containing the waiting Jobs
      Returns:
      the index of the Server with the best specified parameters

    • customSP_good

      private static int customSP_good​(Server[] servers, java.util.PriorityQueue<Event> timeLine)
      This custom scheduling policy selects the best Server based on eligibility criteria of each Server. This consists in a function ƒ(𝑥,𝑦) = φ𝑥 + τy, where 𝑥 := "consecutive position of the next execution end Event" (in other words, a parameter that refers to "when the current executiong Job will finish compared to others servers") 𝑦 := "number of waiting Job in the queue" φ,τ ∈ [0,1] ⊂ ℝ are related weight
      Parameters:
      servers - An array of Server objects, each of them with his currently executing Job (if there is one), and his FIFO queue containing the waiting Jobs
      timeLine - The next upcoming Events in the simulation
      Returns:
      the index of the server with the lowest eligibility value

    • ET

      private static double ET​(int R, double[] endTimes)
      This function calculates the average of a given array of end times.
      Parameters:
      R - the number of end times (number or repetitions)
      endTimes - an array of end times, one value for each repetition
      Returns:
      the average of the end times.

    • AQT_all

      private static double AQT_all​(int R, double[] avgQueuingTimes)
      This function calculates the average queuing time of a Job
      Parameters:
      R - the number of repetitions
      avgQueuingTimes - an array of double values representing the average queuing times for each repetition. The length of the array is R, which is the total number of repetition.
      Returns:
      the total average queuing time for all repetitions

    • AQT

      private static double AQT​(int R, double[][] avgQueuingTimesCategory, int nCat)
      The function calculates the average queuing time for a specific category based on the given average queuing times and the number of repetitions
      Parameters:
      R - the number of repetitions
      avgQueuingTimesCategory - matrix of doubles. It represents the average queuing times for different Categories throughout each repetition. One Category each row, the average queuing time for a repetition each column
      nCat - the category number. It is used to access the specific row in the "avgQueuingTimesCategory" matrix
      Returns:
      the total average queuing time for a specific category.

    • AST

      private static double AST​(int R, double[][] avgServiceTimesCategory, int nCat)
      The function calculates the average service time for a specific category based on the given average service times and the number of repetitions
      Parameters:
      R - the number of repetitions
      avgServiceTimesCategory - matrix of doubles. It represents the average service times for different Categories throughout each repetition. One Category each row, the average service time for a repetition each column
      nCat - the category number. It is used to access the specific row in the "avgServiceTimesCategory" matrix
      Returns:
      the total average service time for a specific category.
